title: Argus Client Config
description: A configuration file which provides client bring-up parameters to the Argus engine. Certain properties pertaining to the client identity are mandatory, but sensible defaults will be used for any non-required information not provided.

id.description: The unique identifier string of the client. This is used internally for things such as config paths.

name.description: The friendly name of the client.

version.description: The current version of the client application.

engine.description: Configuration pertaining to basic engine behavior.

modules.description: The engine modules requested by the client.

render_backends.description: The render backends preferred by the client in order of preference. If none from the list can be used, a default will be used based on the current system.

target_tickrate.description: The target maximum tickrate of the engine. The tickrate is the number of times the update loop runs per second. 0 means no limit.

target_framerate.description: The target maximum framerate of the engine. The framerate is the number of times the render loop runs per second. 0 means no limit. This parameter is applicable only when VSync is disabled.

id.description: The internal unique identifier of the window.

title.description: The initial title of the window.

mode.description: The default windowing mode of the window. This is only applied if a cached value cannot be loaded from disk.

position.description: The initial position of the window on the desktop. This is applicable only if 'mode' is 'windowed'.

x.description: The x-coordinate of the initial window position.

y.description: The y-coordinate of the initial window position.

dimensions.description: The intial dimensions of the window on the desktop. This is applicable only if 'mode' is 'windowed'.

default_bindings_resource.description: The identifier of the resource containing the default input bindings to configure. If a binding configuration is present on disk and 'save_user_bindings' is true, this resource will be used only supplementally.

save_user_bindings.description: Whether to save and load changes to input bindings to and from disk.
